Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs

Description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced that Qualcomm Incorporated agreed to pay $7.5 million to settle charges that it violated the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act by hiring relatives of Chinese government officials deciding whether to select the company's mobile technology products amid increasing competition in the international telecommunications market.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
